com.samsung.fastcast

Class CastManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.fastcast.statemachine.StateMachine<CastStates>
      • com.samsung.fastcast.CastManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateChanger<CastStates>

    public class CastManager
extends StateMachine<CastStates>
    CastManager singleton class to make casting scenarios. It can do service discovery, connection/disconnection to remote channel send messages to host, listen to messages from channel and wrap and proxy errors from MultiScreen Framework. It is implemented as state machine. User can listen for states changes and implement proper GUI changes in own application. Possible states are described in CastStates enumerator.
    Author:
    m.gajewski
    See Also:
    StateMachine, CastStates

    • Method Detail

      • isSuspended

        public boolean isSuspended()
        Check if remote application is in suspend state. You can also listen on this by OnTVMessageListener
        Returns:
        the suspended state.

      • init

        public static void init(Context ctx)
        Static init method have to be called somewhere before use any method from library. Application context is needed by MultiScreen framework.
        Parameters:
        ctx - Android application context.

      • getInstance

        public static CastManager getInstance()
        Static method to get single object of this class. It is alive after call to init method. If init wasn't called first it will return null.
        Returns:
        CastManager object or null if CastManager is not initialized.
        See Also:
        init(Context)

      • getRemoteController

        public RemoteController getRemoteController()
        Gets and returns single object of class RemoteController which is helper for standard operations during casting like play, stop, seek, volume commands and so on. Returned object can be used only after making connection in ready state otherwise it can produce error messages and will fail.
        Returns:
        RemoteController single object.
        See Also:
        RemoteController

      • startDiscovery

        public void startDiscovery()
        Starts discovery process. If new devices are found it is communicated by calling OnDiscoveryListener.onServiceFound() method and if service adapter is set it will add found service to list automatically.
        See Also:
        addOnDiscoveryListener(OnDiscoveryListener), #setServiceAdapter(ArrayAdapter)

      • stopDiscovery

        public void stopDiscovery()
        Stops discovery process. You should stop discovering for example when user already choose service and start connecting to it.

      • connect

        public void connect(ConnectData remote)
        Make connection to chosen device and try find application and connect to channel. All needed data are passed in argument by transport class ConnectData. Service, applicationId and channelId are necessery to make connection.
        Parameters:
        remote - ConnectData object with data needed to make connection.
        See Also:
        ConnectData

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from channel. It leaves remote application on. It is alias for disconnect(false). It can produce error if application wasn't connected or if something gone wrong on the remote device.
        See Also:
        disconnect(boolean)

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(boolean exitRemote)
        Disconnects from channel. If exitRemote is true and it is last connected client it will exit remote application. It can produce error if application wasn't connected or if something gone wrong on the remote device.
        Parameters:
        exitRemote - true for close remote application or false otherwise.

      • send

        public void send(MessageType type,
                 MessageBase msg)
        Sends message to remote device. In theory messages can be send when cast manager is in CONNECTED state and it can be done without error but it is better to send messages when cast manager goes to state READY. It means that connection is established and remote device said that is ready for receiving. To send message you have to pass message type and object with message inherited from MessageBase class.
        Parameters:
        type - MessageType enumerator describing type of message
        msg - Message object inherited from MessageBase
        See Also:
        MessageType, MessageBase

      • sendCustomEvent

        public void sendCustomEvent(CustomEvent customEvent)
        Sends custom event to remote device. In theory messages can be send when cast manager is in CONNECTED state and it can be done without error but it is better to send messages when cast manager goes to state READY. It means that connection is established and remote device said that is ready for receiving.
        Parameters:
        customEvent - Object of your class inherited from CustomEvent and described event you want send
        See Also:
        CustomEvent

      • setServiceAdapter

        public void setServiceAdapter(<any> serviceAdapter)
        Sets ArrayAdapter to fill when new devices are found during discovery process. It can be used when you use Android ListView in GUI and want to fill it by adapter automatically.
        Parameters:
        serviceAdapter - ArrayAdapter object which will be filled in discovery process.

        Adds OnDiscoveryListener to inform about devices found/lost during discovery process.
        Parameters:
        listener - Your OnDiscoveryListener

        Parameters:

      • getConnectedService

        public com.samsung.multiscreen.Service getConnectedService()
        Gets Service associated with remote device to which we are currently connected. If there is no connection this method will return null.
        Returns:
        Connected Service or null.

      • registerCustomEvent

        public boolean registerCustomEvent(CustomEvent customEvent)
        Use this method to register custom event. You have to do that if you want listen on custom events sent from TV application. for details see CustomEvent class.
        Parameters:
        customEvent - Object of your CustomEvent class (has to inherit from CustomEvent
        Returns:
        True on success and false on fail.
        See Also:
        CustomEvent
